newsitem.title: USA: Goodrich Petroleum find test oil, natgas.
newsitem.headline: Goodrich Petroleum find test oil, natgas.

text.p: Goodrich Petroleum Corp said on Wednesday that an exploratory well at South Pecan Lake Field in Cameron Parish, La., flowed a cumulative 216 barrels of oil and 3.7 million cubic feet of natural gas on tests of three zones.

In addition to the three zones tested, there are six other productive zones that are behind pipe in the Goodrich Petroleum, Miami Corp 5 No. 1 well. Goodrich Petroleum said it is the operator and holds an about a 40 percent working interest in the well.

The company also said it has a 12.5 percent working interest in the Williamette Industries Inc No. 2 well in the South Sibley Field in North Louisiana's Webster Parish, which tested at an average rate of 800,000 cubic feet of natural gas and 1.6 barrels of condensate per day.
